intro: Alibertia davidsei, commonly known as the purplestem sandbarren, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a slender, branched stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive purple hue on the underside. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces berries that are used in traditional medicine. Alibertia davidsei is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and riverine environments.
